did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Prince William County (Va.) Records, 1731-1969
did.physloc: State Records Center - Archives Annex, Library of Virginia

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Prince William County (Va.) Records, 1731-1969. Local Government Records Collection, Prince William County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in a shipment of court records from Prince William County. Portions of the collection were transferred under the following accession numbers: 25223, 22656, 24961, 23722, 21178-21189, 20816-20818, 34345, 33797, 21709, 22743b, 20620 and 33797.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Prince William County was formed from Stafford and King George Counties by a statute adopted in 1730, to take effect on 12 March 1731. The county was named for William Augustus, duke of Cumberland and third son of King George II.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Prince William County (Va.) Records, 1731-1969, include various records from the following series: County and Circuit Court Records, Election Records, Fiduciary Records, Land Records, Miscellaneous Records, Tax and Fiscal Records and Wills.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Item 1050828 is found at the Library of Virginia.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Prince William Additional Prince William County Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm"

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Prince William County Prince William County is one of Virginia's Lost Records Localities. Additional Prince William Court Records may be found in the Virginia Lost Records Localities Collection at the Library of Virginia. Search the Lost Records Localites Database found on the Library of Virginia's web site.

did.unittitle: Records, 1921 circa, 1937

scopecontent.p: Court Records: Board of Supervisors vs. J. P. Leachman, County Treasurer, 1921 ca. Leachman accused of forgery. Election Records: Municipal elections - town of Manassas, 8 June 1937
Miscellaneous records, correspondence, list of tax collected, executions

did.unittitle: Records, 1834, 1897

scopecontent.p: Settlement of Estates by sheriff as administrator, miscellaneous papers (correspondence, accounts, court papers) concerning Magow family of Gainesville.

Court Records: Criminal Records: Commonwealth vs. W.W. Garrison (forgery); Judgment: Admr. of Whetzel vs. Southern Railroad Company; Tax and Fiscal Records: Cash Receipts and Disbursements, 1967-1969, Miscellaneous financial records; Miscellaneous Records: Unidentified photograph

did.unittitle: Records, 1731-1806

scopecontent.p: Rent Rolls, 1723, 1768, 1773; Memorandum concerning James Carter's Rent Roll, 1729; Lectures on Grammar, 1806: Writ - Ann Lewis to appear in court, 1784; Bonds, Writs, Petitions, Orders, 1747-1785

did.unittitle: Records, 1671-1672

scopecontent.p: 14 December 1671-15 February 1672 includes depositions, deeds and wills
